Sequence Information.Peptide Name: GKY25 (Thrombin-derived C-terminal Peptides TCP, natural AMPs, primates, mammals, animals, UCLL1; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: in human wound fluid and fibrin

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (38.46%) toP-02K: 16%; GRAVY: -0.524; M. Wt: 3088.594; Mol formula: C149H220N37O35; Mol Ex Coeff: 8530;Activity:  XX.Animal model:mouse: protect against P. aeruginosa sepsis, mainly via reduction of both systemic cytokine responses and excessive coagulation.Anti-inflammatory: GKY25 binds to LPS and interferes with TLR4/myeloid differentiation protein-2 dimerization, leading to inhibition of TLR4 dimerization and subsequent reduction of NF-kB activity and proinflammatory cytokine production in monocytes and macrophages (Hansen et al., 2015).The original entry kalata B9 linear has been merged with entry 1108 due to the same sequence.
Literature Information.Author: Papareddy P, Rydengård V, Pasupuleti M, Walse B, Mörgelin M, Chalupka A, Malmsten M, Schmidtchen A. 2010
Literature Information.Title: Proteolysis of human thrombin generates novel host defense peptides.
